SEARCH
Package org.jlab.mya

Class RunningStatistics

java.lang.Object
org.jlab.mya.RunningStatistics
public class RunningStatistics extends Object
This class provides summary statistics about the specified set of MYA data. This class makes a best effort at using online and numerically stable algorithms for calculating the provided statistics.

The class can be used to obtain stats on the entire series, but also incrementally per event.

    Create an instance of the RunningStatistics class that tracks series stats, but no event stats.

    Create an instance of the RunningStatistics class that tracks series stats, plus the specified event stats.

      public static final short INTEGRATION
      Integration statistic
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • RunningStatistics

      public RunningStatistics()
      Create an instance of the RunningStatistics class that tracks series stats, but no event stats.

    • RunningStatistics

      public RunningStatistics(short[] eventStatsMap)
      Create an instance of the RunningStatistics class that tracks series stats, plus the specified event stats.

      Event Stats are specified by short value and array index. Valid values are assigned constants and include RunningStatistics.INTEGRATION.

      Parameters:
      eventStatsMap - The event stats to track

  • Method Details

    • reset

      public void reset()
      This method clears the running statistics calculated thus far, resetting the RunningStatistics object to it's initial state.

    • push

      public void push(FloatEvent event)
      This function updates the set of running statistics for a given channel history for the given event.
      Parameters:
      event - The next event in the channel history to add to the calculation of statistics.

    • getMin

      public Double getMin()
      Get the minimum value thus far.
      Returns:
      The minimum value of the channel history or null if the statistic is invalid

    • getMax

      public Double getMax()
      Get the maximum value thus far.
      Returns:
      The maximum value of the channel history or null if the statistic is invalid

    • getMean

      public Double getMean()
      Get the mean of the values seen so far
      Returns:
      The mean (average) value of the channel history or null if the statistic is invalid

    • getSigma

      public Double getSigma()
      Get the standard deviation of the values seen so far. Note: This provides no bias correction. Users with knowledge of the underlying EPICS data may wish to apply a bias correction to sampling, e.g., multiplying by N / (N-1).
      Returns:
      The variance of the channel history or null if the statistic is invalid

    • getRms

      public Double getRms()
      Get the RMS of the values seen so far. This is a computed statistic equivalent to Math.sqrt(sigma*sigma + mean * mean);
      Returns:
      The RMS of the channel history or null if the statistic is invalid

    • getDuration

      public Double getDuration()
      Get the amount of time for which valid data was available in the MYA channel history. This is generally not the same as the difference between begin and end parameters of a query as it excludes time for which the channel history last recorded a non Event.UPDATE event.
      Returns:
      The time duration of the channel history for which data was available or null if the statistic is invalid

    • getIntegration

      public Double getIntegration()
      Get the integrated value of the channel with respect to time.
      Returns:
      The result of integrating across the channel history for which data was available or null if the statistic is invalid.

    • getEventCount

      public long getEventCount()
      Get the number of events pushed to the RunningStatistics object.
      Returns:
      The number of events

    • getUpdateCount

      public long getUpdateCount()
      Get the number of events pushed to the RunningStatistics whose EventCode was Event.UPDATE.
      Returns:
      The number of update events

    • getEventStats

      public double[] getEventStats()
      Obtain the event stats.

      stats and their index (order) are specified in the constructor.

      Returns:
      The stats
